title: Collaborative Attitude Change Microlearning for Human Trafficking Awareness

context.additional_context: An environment where students access mobile learning via personal devices in small groups, receiving continuous feedback through formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the definition and social impact of human trafficking by presenting three or more specific cases.
Learners engage in active listening to peers' perspectives and reflect on their own attitudes during collaborative discussions at least five times.
Learners develop and share at least two practical action plans for preventing human trafficking.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
